item.title: Agroforestry's Impacts
item.description: Vi Agroforestry Tree Nursery Agroforestry—planting trees on farms—has a lot of benefits for the world at large: trees prevent erosion, store carbon, and provide refuge habitats within the agricultural landscape. And agronomists have reported that trees can support soil health and increase soil organic matter, improving the long-term sustainability of farming systems. But is agroforestry good for the farmer’s bottom line? That’s what we set out to find in the ICRAF study “Assessing the Downstream Socioeconomic Impacts of Agroforestry in Kenya.
